messageBody:
Hi, experts

Since our project wants to save the failed environment for a failed test case, I tried to implement my own TestListener which did the work in TestListener.addFailure and TestListener.addError. But it doesn't work, could you please figure out the errors in my program, thanks.

import junit.framework.AssertionFailedError;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestResult;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;
import junit.framework.TestListener;

public class NewTest extends TestCase {
class MyListener implements TestListener {
private TestCase test;

public MyListener(TestCase test) {
this.test = test;
}

public void addError(Test test, Throwable t) {
System.out.println("Detecing an error.");
}

public void addFailure(Test test, AssertionFailedError t) {
System.out.println("Detecing a failure.");
}

public void endTest(Test test) {
System.out.println("End a test.");
}

public void startTest(Test test) {
System.out.println("Start a test.");
}
}

public void setUp() {
System.out.println("Doing setup.");
}

public void tearDown() {
System.out.println("Doing tearDown.");
}

@Override
protected TestResult createResult() {
System.out.println("Invoked.");
TestResult result = new TestResult();
result.addListener(new MyListener(this));

return result;
}

public void testA() {
System.out.println("Doing testA.");
fail("Expected failure.");
}

public void testB() {
System.out.println("Doing testB.");
}
}

I think if I implement my own TestListener and register it with a TestResult in createResult method, that TestResult should replace the default one, but it doesn't work.

Thanks for any help!

Regards!
Tao
